reviews.text: Loved the place. Found this when I was talking a walk back to the Carlton City hotel. It's a cozy little place on Duxton Road which barely fits more than 10 people but it's totally worth the visit. The young bar lady was very nice and eager to help, coffee and cake was delicious. The place also offers (limited) outside seating. Come here if you want to stear clear from the large coffee chains and love local flavour. Will be looking forward to coming back!

A cafÃ© with sooo much hidden personality behind their curtains, Monument was a surpisingly great hit on a Sunday afternoon. Wishing they had more food options, but I had their piccolo and sesame bagel with garlic chilli cream cheese, and both hits the mark! their cool-meets-quirky indie vibe was outstanding, and I'll definitely be back for more chill days.

Small cafe with more seating at back area but not many people know about it. Service was good. Picolo was good. Cheddar cheese bagel with garlic herb cream cheese with a small fee. Bagel was good but a bit oily maybe due to cheese. Cream cheese taste mild.
Cute cafe! Ample seating, good WiFi, and never crowded on weekdays. Iced latte has great flavor, but hot latte tasted a bit too watery.

Good place to relax,nice homey ambience.less crowded than others within the area.good sandwich, tasty! Give a try on the pastries too,they definitely choose a good baker for those they selling. And great coffee.high quality coffee beans from Liberty, one of the pioneer in local coffee roastery.slightly in higher price,ice latte for $8.50 but it's worth it!ðŸ˜Š
